tit.e: Fukurozoshi (a treatise on waka [a traditional Japanese poem of 31 syllables] written by FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke)

sen.j: 袋草紙（ふくろぞうし）は、平安時代後期の保元年間（1156年－1159年）頃に公家で六条家流の歌人であった藤原清輔が著した歌論書である。
sen.e: Fukurozoshi was a collection of poetic lore written during the Hogen era (1156 - 1159) by FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke, who was the court noble and a poet belonged to the Rokujo poetic family.

Fukurozoshi is a treatise on waka poetry written during the Hogen era (1156 - 1159) in late Heian period by FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke, who was a court noble and a poet in a linage of the Rokujo family.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「平安時代後期の」を補足しました。

sen.e: Fukurozoshi consists of four volumes and a volume of a collection of old works.

sen.j: 内容については、和歌の作り方や勅撰和歌集、歌合、歌物語、歌人に関する伝承などについて述べられており、和歌や歌人に関する重要な資料のひとつとなっている。
sen.e: Fukurozoshi is considered as one of the important materials on waka poetry and waka poets with the contents of how to compose waka, about imperial anthologies of poetry, poetry contest 'uta-awase', poetic tales 'uta monogatari', legends about poets.
